DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: This page contains brief information about glasdegib maleate and a collection of links to more information about the use of this drug, research results, and ongoing clinical trials.
DrugInfoMetaData.FDAExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Para.ExternalRef: FDA label information for this drug is available at DailyMed.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Glasdegib maleate is approved to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Acute myeloid leukemia that is newly diagnosed. It is used with low-dose cytarabine in patients aged 75 years and older or adults who cannot be treated with intensive induction chemotherapy.

Section.Para: Glasdegib maleate is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.

Section.Title: More About Glasdegib Maleate
Section.Para: Definition from the NCI Drug Dictionary - Detailed scientific definition and other names for this drug.

ItemizedList.ListItem: what this drug is used for and how it is used,
what you should tell your doctor before using this drug,
what you should know about this drug before using it,
other drugs that may interact with this drug, and

Section.Para: Drugs are often studied to find out if they can help treat or prevent conditions other than the ones they are approved for. This patient information sheet applies only to approved uses of the drug. However, much of the information may also apply to unapproved uses that are being studied.

Section.Title: Clinical Trials Accepting Patients
Section.Para: Find Clinical Trials for Glasdegib Maleate - Check for trials from NCI's list of cancer clinical trials now accepting patients.

DrugInfoDisclaimer.Para: Important: The drug information on this page is meant to be educational. It is not a substitute for medical advice. The information may not cover all possible uses, actions, interactions, or side effects of this drug, or precautions to be taken while using it. Please see your health care professional for more information about your specific medical condition and the use of this drug.
